articles.headline: Back from the Dead: “Extinct” Fish Rediscovered in a Remote Bolivian Pond After 20 Years
articles.summary: A tiny fish long feared lost has resurfaced in Bolivia, offering a rare conservation success story amid widespread habitat destruction.

articles.headline: This Popular Painkiller May Do More Harm Than Good
articles.summary: Tramadol, often seen as a safer painkiller, may not be as effective as believed, with a large analysis showing modest relief for chronic pain.

articles.headline: Oceans Are Supercharging Hurricanes Past Category 5
articles.summary: Deep ocean hot spots are making the strongest hurricanes and typhoons more likely and dangerous, expanding due to climate change.

articles.headline: Astronomers Discover One of the Universe’s Largest Spinning Structures
articles.summary: Scientists have found a giant cosmic filament where galaxies spin in sync, revealing new insights into the structure of the universe.

articles.headline: A Christmas Tree 80 Light-years Wide Appears in Space
articles.summary: Astronomers highlight a spectacular region of space resembling a glowing holiday tree, known as NGC 2264, filled with newborn stars.

articles.headline: Steelers’ DK Metcalf suspension over altercation with fan upheld
articles.summary: The NFL has upheld the suspension of Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf following an altercation with a fan, with lawyers indicating that the fan is now facing threats after the incident.

articles.headline: Chiefs announce move across state line from Missouri after Kansas lawmakers approve new domed stadium proposal
articles.summary: The Kansas City Chiefs have confirmed their relocation across the state line from Missouri following the approval of a new domed stadium by Kansas lawmakers.

articles.headline: Georgetown head basketball coach Ed Cooley suspended after throwing water bottle that hit child
articles.summary: Georgetown Hoyas head coach Ed Cooley has been suspended after an incident where he threw a water bottle that accidentally hit a child during a game.

articles.headline: Dallas Cowboys defeat Washington Commanders on Christmas Day
articles.summary: In a thrilling Christmas Day matchup, the Dallas Cowboys triumphed over the Washington Commanders with a final score of 30-23.

articles.headline: Anthony Joshua knocks out Jake Paul in heavyweight bout
articles.summary: In a highly anticipated fight, Anthony Joshua secured a knockout victory over Jake Paul, further solidifying his status in the boxing world.

articles.headline: Waymo's San Francisco outage raises doubts over robotaxi readiness during crises
articles.summary: A widespread power outage in San Francisco that led to Waymo robotaxis stalling and snarling traffic earlier this month has raised concerns about the readiness of autonomous vehicle operators to tackle major emergencies like earthquakes and floods.

articles.headline: China issues draft rules to regulate AI with human-like interaction
articles.summary: China has released draft regulations aimed at overseeing artificial intelligence technologies that engage in human-like interactions, reflecting growing concerns about the implications of AI in society.

articles.headline: Nvidia will license Groq tech, hire its executives
articles.summary: Nvidia is set to acquire AI chip startup Groq for approximately $20 billion, which includes licensing its technology and hiring its executives to bolster Nvidia's AI capabilities.

articles.headline: NY Governor Hochul signs bill requiring warning labels on ‘addictive’ social media
articles.summary: New York Governor Kathy Hochul has signed a bill mandating warning labels on social media platforms deemed addictive, aiming to address concerns over mental health impacts.

articles.headline: Meet the team that investigates when journalists and activists get hacked with government spyware
articles.summary: A dedicated team has emerged to investigate cases where journalists and activists are targeted by government spyware, highlighting the ongoing battle for digital privacy and security.
